title: Constant Crashing leading to Low Priority que
body:
Ive been playing League for 3 years and have never been banned once but I'm unfortunately getting close to my first bannable offense unintentionally. I took a break from league for a few months and when I came back about a week ago (playing about a game or 2 a day since return) My game crashes while going into the game from champ select about every 2-3 games and forces me to fix my client after continuously not being able to reconnect. I was placed in low priority que then after three games my client crashed and made me fix installation again. In case my specs are needed I'll list them below
my specs are
cpu: Intel core i5 4460
gpu: gtx geforce 970 twin fozr
hard drive: hitachi htc
mobo: Asus Rock anniversary
psu: corsair 600M 
ram: 8gb

replies.body:
If you're having to repair your client often as a result of crashes, it's likely that your installation is heavily corrupted. When crucial files are missing from the client, it's likely to cause not only poor performance in-game but also can crash your client at any point. I recommend grabbing our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/player-support/tools/Hextech%20Repair%20Tool.msi), checking the box for Reinstall along with the box for a Clean uninstall. Let this run for a while, then ensure League has the right [system permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions#wq3) to run. 

Let me know if these steps caused any change.
Will try this tonight, thank you.
